reviews:
I think people are expecting miracles for a 10.00 flashlight (2 for 19,99). They are not 1600 lumens, about the same brightness as my 250 lumens flashlight, with AAAs This same flashlight is made and sold under 50 different names.

The draw current on these is high.... it will eat through alkaline AAAs in no time, just like a digital camera flash.... you need to use rechargeable AAAs like eneloops with these due to the current draw. I got approx 1 1/2 hour run time on high, with the eneloops. These flashlights were designed around the 18650 cells and that is where they run best. Interesting enough both of the these flashlights do not have the same T6 led. One is cool white (blueish white) and one is neutral white (soft yellowish). Don't know if it was supposed to be the same or not. But I got one of each color.

So for the price of 10.00 they are excellent. Don't try and compare these to higher quality 150 to 400 flashlights, such as Olights and other expensive brands, they are not. One will go in the truck glove box and the other as a beater around the farm...

I like the flood light on the zoom for walking around the yard....

review_title: Great Value in a Bright, Compact Flashlight
reviews:
Excellent flashlight. It's bright enough for most uses, ruggedly built and has useful features. It's weather sealed and the batteries are easily swapped out. Some reviewers complain you can't turn it off except by cycling through all modes to the end. This isn't true. Turn full-on by fully pressing the button until it clicks, then off by doing the same. If you turn on again within a couple of seconds, you get the next mode but if you wait more than that, you simply get full-on again, then off at any time by fully pressing. Be mindful of the delay interval and experiment. You'll get the hang of it. From full-on you can go through each mode in sequence by pressing the button part-way without having to turn on/off. As for battery life, this is commonly a problem with small, bright flashlights as they don't have room for large cells. Do yourself a favor and get some "EBL" 1100 mAh NiMH AAA's and a "Kinden" smart charger - all available on Amazon. "EBL"s are a superior rechargeable that hold a lot of juice, have exceptional shelf-life between uses and charge to a higher voltage than much of the competition. I get an easy 2 hours full brightness constant "on" in this flashlight with dimming to extinction over an additional 20 minutes. That's long enough for me. Get extra batteries so you always have some ready to go. The "Kinden" is a pricier charger but will handle practically all types of cells while providing totally safe charging. You can go broke buying non-rechargeables. A good charging setup with quality batteries soon pays for itself.

Update: I've done another test of battery endurance. If you select the low brightness setting, which is still plenty bright as far as I am concerned, you will get a solid 8 - 10 hours with insignificant fade. At 15 hours it's certainly dim but still just fine for navigating your way around a totally dark room. Have not tested the mid-brightness endurance but would expect a good 6+ hours.

reviews: As advertised. Well made, with some useful features (and for me, some not-so-useful ones). The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because I don't understand why the designers of this product incorporated the mode switch in the on/off switch. It is impossible to set the light to medium or low without cycling through high and the strobe and SOS settings. I use it for photography, and having it come on with whatever mode follows the on you used last is a royal pain. EG, use it on low, turn it off. Turn it on and it starts up with strobe mode, so you have to cycle through that and SOS mode to get to high, then cycle through medium to get to low. Very poor design in that way, but excellent quality in all other ways.

reviews:
Love these lights!
I have been using these lights a couple months before deciding I would post a review. I carry one with me as a bus driver 13 plus hours a day 4-5 days a week (I do split shifts). I always wear a safety vest and the lanyard attaches to one of my pockets. The lights get lots of bumps and abuse with no problems so far.
Things I like, on off button is on the end and protected from accidental turning it on, they seem well made and are very durable......AND they are VERY bright! I chose to use the 18650 batteries and charger I purchased from Gracetop on Amazon so maybe that helps brightness.
The only problem so far is 1 of the lanyards broke, hence the 4 stars, otherwise it would be 5 stars. Because the light is metal with 2 holes drilled in the end I will figure out another more permanent solution.
Definitely recommend and I would buy again, good value for money.

review_title: The light however will focus nicely by simply pulling it in or out to the ...
reviews: This light has more power than my older 5 cell aluminum flash light which I have been using the past 10 or more years. There are no "O" rings in it so I cannot see how it would be waterproof as seen on TV. Also on one of the four lights I purchased, the zoom focus by twisting the forward part of the light does not work, The inclined threads in the body of the light are to shallow to engage the threads in the outside part. The light however will focus nicely by simply pulling it in or out to the desired position. Unlike my old 5 cell light, this one has some features that will come in handy in this part of the world. The bright flashing strobe effect I am sure will slow down black bears at night and cause them to retreat to the bushes, only to come back again when the light goes off. Other than those issues, the light is compact, powerful, and easier to carry compared to my large flashlight. Its' half power setting would be good for providing a steady light during power outages or camping in a tent. The only thing wrong with one is you will likely want a second for the car.

review_title: First impression is that they are smaller and much lighter than expected which isn't necessarily a bad thing. Haven't picked up any 18650 batteries yet ...
reviews:
Bought these to replace my old mag-lites in our camping and emergency kits.

First impression is that they are smaller and much lighter than expected which isn't necessarily a bad thing.
Haven't picked up any 18650 batteries yet so trying them out using decent quality procell aaa's.
Using a luxmeter at 5 feet and the flashlights focus set to the widest angle I was able to measure 500lumen, which is pretty impressive.
As a comparison my 4 D cell maglite only register 130 lumen with a focused beam.
I imagine that it would be much closer to the 1600 lumen advertised if I used 18650 batteries.

Now for the bad news. These arrived Monday, it is now Thursday. One was dropped on the carpeted floor and no longer works.
So I won't be using them for camping, or in an emergency kit. Where I need to know it will always work.

As a general purpose flashlight these will likely do fine.

Then I got the rechargeable LI-ION 3000 mah batteries hoping it would be better and, although the light was significantly brighter with that battery, it barely lasted longer. Maybe 2 hours of use. reviews:
*** UPDATE ****

After 5 months of random use (roughly 2 hours use over that period of time), one of the two lights I purchased died. The build quality is good, but the LED chips they put in these must be rejects that CREE gives away for free.

Basically garbage, but what do you expect for that price.

Live & learn.

=============================================================

The build is solid, they are water proof and have strobe, SOS and 3 dimming modes. Comes with spacers for 18650 batteries (power forever) and adapters to use 3 AAA batteries instead.

The zoom focus is amazing. In a power outage situation, these lights when zoomed out completely and placed on the floor creates a 20 ft radius bright light on your ceiling lighting up an entire room.

Not sure if Amazon still sells OLIGHT 18650 batteries, but if they do I highly recommend.

reviews: I bought one of these flashlights last year for an early start to moose hunting. I really liked the area of light coverage but unfortunately when I arrived home, I was missing my flashlight and thought it lost until a year later when I did the same trip and while taking a rest on a rock and waiting for daylight to come on, I saw something sticking up through the moss and there was my flashlight. To my utter amazement it worked just fine. I said to my buddy that it was subjected to freezing temperatures, ice, rain and everything that our climate can throw at it. Folks, trust me, this is one durable flashlight.

review_title: It would have been nice if it remembered the last setting instead of switching ...
reviews:
I just got these flashlights today and they sure are bright. I now have light spots in my vision and I didn't even look into the LED, just from wall reflection. The settings range from High, Medium, Low, Strobe, SOS. The settings do change every time the flashlight turns off and back on again. It would have been nice if it remembered the last setting instead of switching every time. The lenses had a couple scuffs in them and there was extra o'rings kicking around in the package. The flashlights don't seem to be missing any o'rings as they are present where the bottom comes off to insert the batteries so I assume they are extras. I got the double pack and one of the LEDs is a blue/white and the other is more of a natural white. Not sure why they are different. I would have preferred both being the natural light. The adjustable focus head is much looser that the other. In fact the looser on feels broken. But the price can't be beat so one can't be too picky. Perhaps I’ll request an exchange.

Update: The flash light will remember the last setting as long as the light mode as been on for at least 4 seconds. The next time you switch the flash light back on, it will be at that last used light mode.

review_title: Be aware of the TV commercial
reviews:
It just an O.K. flashlight - nothing special. I'm not sure if its a scam but the TV commercial is highly misleading. I watched the TV advertisement with my son who became very excited that they were selling a "High End" product i.e. the best of flashlights available. Once you go to the online store [...] to purchase the flashlights they will pull the "Bait and Switch" and try to get you to buy a much more expensive and better performing (brighter) flashlight. This happens only after you commit to buying the lower end flashlight (i.e. after you give them your credit card information). In the end you get billed for and shipped an average flashlight after being lured by the TV commercial offering a high end product at a low price.

At least if you buy it from Amazon you know what you are getting - just know that it is not the top flashlight they offer and it will be up to you to decide if it is "similar to flashlights used by elite military units".

review_title: Amazing value - expect fast AAA battery use
reviews:
This flashlight is fairly bright. The photos attached show its power from 8m away. I am using AAA batteries at 1.4V for the first images. The 2nd set is using batteries at 1.13V (a level which other flashlights barely produce light). The zooming feature is pointless to me but it works. The images show the extreme ends of the capabilities. The head is secured only through friction however, so I'm skeptical if it can retain itself at different positions after many uses.
Very useful however for use around the house or walks at night. This is a borderline tactical flashlight at night which should stun someone with its intensity. Keeping the focused beam on someone will distract a person, but that can be achieved by most lights.
I am unsure how long this level of brightness can be sustained. I hope that this flashlight can last 1 year of moderate use before replacing AAAs.

Edit: changed to 5 stars after using it outside in pitch black lighting. It shines well in the distance and is very clear. Accidentally found out about the strobing and SOS modes as well. A bit clunky to trigger but once you get used to the method it is easy.

Update: I have used this light for about 2 months now - approximately 10 minutes of use per day. The batteries are now drained to 1.07V, but is still bright enough to see the ground in front of you. Distances aren't clear, but provides some visibility. It isn't a shock to see the battery drain this quickly for how bright it is. I am keeping this product at 5 stars with the expectation of trading out battery life for high lumens. It would be great to have the option of adjusting intensity levels to preserve battery life. I will try the 18650 rechargeable battery next to review the cost-benefit ratio.

review_title: Very bright, much better than LED lights
reviews:
These are very bright and I'm happy to have something better than the little LED flashlights so commonly sold now. We have a bunch of those for camping and it's nice that they're small and cheap but you get what you pay for. Some of those are fine but many have weak lights or don't last. I had thought that I would still want to buy a full-sized and even more legit flashlight, like a large mag-lite, to keep around my house, but we will use these guys as both our home flashlights and camping / emergency car flashlights.

Arrived quickly. Product was as-advertised.

Tip: Don't throw away the plastic tube thing that comes with each flashlight. That's an adapter for if you don't want to use 3 AAA batteries. I got these flashlights for my friend and she accidentally tossed those bits. (Oops!) AAA batteries work fine though so you can throw the tubes away if you want to.

review_title: Problemm Corrected (original shipment had one defective battery holder).
reviews:
One of the original pair of flashlights had a defective AAA battery holder. After contacting the seller (see below) they sent me replacements and I am a satisfied customer. I cannot attest to the number of lumens produced by these flashlights (some reviews seem to think they don't produce as claimed) but they are plenty bright for my purposes and seem to be quite well built.

YIFENG,
I received a pair of your flashlights today (Tactical Flashlight, YIFENG XML T6 Ultra Bright LED Taclight with Adjustable Focus and 5 Light Modes for Camping Hiking Emergency (2 pack)). They are pretty much what I expected and am generally pleased except for one thing: one of the AAA battery holders was missing a spring. The other one was fine and I tried it in both flashlights to see if they both worked. They did, but unless/until I get an intact battery holder, I cannot have both units operational simultaneously. How do I go about getting this corrected?

review_title: Do not go by old 2016 reviews, new units are poorer & inconsistent quality
reviews:
*UPDATE* 2500k color temp difference between the 2 new lights! 1 is blue/white, the other has an amber hue w/slight greenish cast. Cleaned, swapped battery packs, no diff...problem is the diode unit.

.Meant to purchase more of the flashlights history shows I purchased 11/16 & the ad pics were identical but, the lights are not. The new units have barely discernible o-rings & the same flimsy orange switch covers found on a cheaper pair also purchased 11/16. The covers require frequent re centering to positively activate the light. The part # on the box does not correspond to either ad or show as an item in amazon search.

These were intended to be mountain bike headlights as the 1st set are employed but, these will have to go to the drawer for less demanding tasks.

review_title: Edited: decent, great light, really hard to slide, dome broke in less than a month, carried it in my pocket twice, one drop...
reviews:
I bought 4 of them so my assistant can have two for he and his wife. These are very very good lights. If yours isn't bright check your batteries. The strobe effect is very good for diorienting a would be attacker and the eyesocket or if you miss bridge of the nose is a great defensive technique. But you should run, probably. Do you fight or flight? Strobe either way so remember to turn it off on the third brightness on a security walk. The strobe seems to disorient more effectively than full light, but full light works. Also you can then send the help signal directly after you've loosened the eye from it's socket. People seem less prone to continuing an attack with eye problems than they do with a broken nose.

You have my words!

Taking some major stars away because I've only had it a month, the damn dome popped out today. I'd been trying to get to an emergency alarm and dropped the light on the metal stairwell. It didn't even drop on the dome, just the side, and ONE stair, grabbed it before it rolled off. Noticed today the focus was off. No lense. It had just fallen out while on the shelf. Survived the fall for the use but it cracked the dome and shattered the middle, no dome left. So much for durability. I've dropped my little keychain lights down these stairs and they still work, just they are little LED cheapo by the registers. I have another and ordered two more as they are good lights but basically I've managed to repair it and have a decent flood light.

Also I've had a few of these, no problems, but the slider on this thing is tight. Unsure if there is a way to make it more smooth like my old green button. I'd have called the manufacturer but I've never gotten a good response from any company, and had another emergency tonight, work related so had to attach the dome. Probably voids some warranty. Good way tho, cheap silicone pops off, you probably glue it (don't do this btw, needs a specific silicone, didn't see a very good seal here, bathroom caulk is all I had and feels more stable but sadly the dome is cracked so it's just siliconed together.) Exterior is strong, dome seal and the lense are low quality, but I'll try the other one out while I wait for my order

Edit

Okay so after six of these I got two that slide appropriate, light has a blue tiny vs the pure white, but overall it's okay. Cheap for a reason but def a good light to keep around, just check the solder job on the springs, one was snapped on one side upon arrival, one was barely holding on, the rest seemed okay, lenses and seals were damaged on most of them, so I'll keep those two around, but won't order any more. Repaired the others and gave them as gifts outside of one that somehow fogged up, I'm not sure how, but it just fogged up like super glue or something had been applied. Either way, okay light, you'll probably like it if you aren't familiar with the torch crowd, but it's supposed to slide easily with your thumb as to not lose sight of the target. The rest felt like they had a seal broken or the metal was cut wrong. The two I have will do for the car, but I'll be replacing my torch soon. Decent little bezels on these just make sure they are tight! No optic silicone, just a flimsy rubber seal. And it is not water resistant. This may have likely caused the fog up as it was humid outside, high humidity, seemed to get less light but I'd assumed maybe the batteries were dying. Brought it inside and the lense fogged up. Still have it for a back up, but the first one cracked.

Do not drop this light, especially if you have the handle, button, etc off. It dents from a minor drop

review_title: Excellent light coverage for a decent price
reviews:
I think Cree might make and distribute the exact flashlight to different companies under their brand name. My friend purchased his flashlight for $16.99 from a catalog under the Bell & Howell brand name. I checked Amazon for the same flashlight and when I brought it up under Bell and Howell discovered several others that came up at the same time. Looking at the photos and studying the descriptions I determined these flashlights were the same as the Bell & Howell Taclights my friend bought.

We received our order yesterday and inserted the batteries, testing them out in a dark room. They appear to be just as strong as the Bell and Howell for half the price. So far, we have no complaints, however, we haven't used them for an extended amount of time. I will leave my excellent rating unless future use requires me to change my rating. I would buy these again as the size is small, the flashlight seems sturdy and the light is very bright. The telescoping feature is excellent as well and the width of the expansion beats my Duracell flashlight that is 4 times heavier and larger.

review_title: Would Not Buy - Big Difference Between Claimed Brightness & Actual Brightness, Poor Customer Service
reviews: Read lots of reviews, checked out a large number of different products. Bought this set. Was hoping to get something that would be as bright as what's claimed and not leave my wallet too empty. I have no idea where some of these reviews are coming from because the actual brightness of these (I tested both numerous times) was SIGNIFICANTLY less than what is claimed. Yes, I tried both of them in different locations. Yes, I tested them using different batteries (used, news, different brands, etc.). I contacted their customer service. They got right back to me. We had several exchanges (reasonable/professional) with the usual questions such as whether I had tried new batteries, were they both the same brightness, etc. They assured me they would send a replacement. I thought I was on the right track with them until they went "radio silent". Nothing. So my thinking is this...if you discount the hyperbolic reviews about the flashlights being the most amazing e-v-e-r, you end up with a mixed bag. The likelihood that I happened to get two bad flashlights and that all the rest are great and extremely bright...that just doesn't add up. I would guess (without a formal measure, but with lots of experience with different lights from cheap to higher end lights such as Surefire), that these are at most, 60 lumens. At most. Definitely do not recommend you buy these. Either try a different manufacturer/seller or just spend more and go for better quality. I would normally say that you get what you pay for with this one, but with their claims of very high brightness, it seems really more a matter of deception. I did not add any ratings for battery life or water resistance since I did not test those features/behavior.

Switches all work good. As far as durability, unknown as I haven't dropped it yet or done any tough testing.

reviews: Ordered 4 of these to have around the house. Yes I understand these aren't expensive lights. I knew this going in. Its a mass produced flashlight under different names all over Amazon. As for brightness they will do. They are pretty bright for 3AAA batteries and some light is better than no light. The lenses are plastic and mine had fingerprints all over the lenses and were scratched up. I removed the lenses via the screw cap and cleaned them as best I could, helped a little but scratches and imperfections are there from production. Poor quality control, but then again these are slapped together and sold from overseas as quickly as possible. You are not getting a high end flashlight. You are getting a decent light that will work for a while and if it goes out you just purchase another considering the price.

I put them in the cars and a couple of months later I broke down and grabbed the flashlight. I turned it on and it just cycles thru all the modes, turns off and on and won't stop. I put in another set of fresh batteries and the same thing happens.
An emergency flashlight is useless if it won't work. Unfortunately it was past the return period so I'm out of luck. I would not recommend these flashlights, you can't depend on them.

review_title: Nothing fantastic, about what you'd expect for the price
reviews:
These are... ok. They don't put out the advertised amount of light, and despite being "tactical" I don't know that they'd hold up all that well if you tried to gouge someone with one. But they are fairly bright, lightweight, and take a 18650 battery (or three AAA's), which is fine for emergencies. The "focus" gimmick works, but the tightest beam basically projects an image of the square led itself, which adds distraction to what you're looking at. The focus being adjustable is a minor selling point anyway. I do like the SOS option.

Basically, cheap Chinese hunks of metal, and there's better and brighter to be found. But for the price, they make decent emergency lights.
product_name: Tactical Flashlight, YIFENG XML T6 Ultra Bright LED Flashlight with Adjustable Focus and 5 Light Modes for Camping Hiking (2 Pack)
rank:

#4 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
One of the two flashlights shorted out (was not dropped) while it was sitting on a table and caused the 18650 Lithium-ion battery to spontaneously heat up and explode within the cannister with a loud POP, and with much acrid smoke produced, and it slightly burned the table it was sitting on. The flashlight was not sitting in the sun and the room was air conditioned, so the battery couldn't have overheated because of room conditions. Fortunately, I was present when this happened and nothing nearby caught fire from touching the extremely hot flashlight cannister, but it was a VERY disconcerting incident and potentially dangerous too! I'm grateful that I wasn't carrying the flashlight in a pocket at the time of this incident.

Since I had not abused the flashlight,I attribute this incident to the cheap construction of this unit. This may (or may not) be a rare incident, but it's definitely too much for me, and I would never buy these flashlights again. And I'm now wary of the 18650 batteries too and have switched back to AAA rechargebles which (I hope) are less likely to experience a "thermal runaway" chemical reaction from being overheated by a mechanical short. I now store the remaining flashlight and its battery separately while I look for a much better made flashlight that's not absurdly expensive for night-time outdoor use on my farm.

The remaining flashlight performs well, and fully meets my needs (as did the other one until it exploded), but I now use it sparingly and very carefully until I can find a worthwhile replacement.

reviews: Overall not bad flashlights for the price. Better than the free ones from Harbor Freight. The only downside is the on/off button. So if you have it on low beam when you turn it off, the next time you turn it on you'll get an epileptic seizure from the party mode (strobe) setting. Pretty annoying, but it seems most flashlights are going this way. I haven't tried them with 18650 batteries yet, but I have compared AAA alkaline and rechargeable batteries. Alkaline are much brighter than NiMH (1.5v vs. 1.2v). I'll update when I get some 18650s.

reviews:
Seems to work great just delivered. I was instructions were included. The battery compartment is at the bottom needs to be unscrewed and pulled out. On off is on the bottom green button

Just received this from the company:
★ Operation Instruction
◆ Battery installation method:
I: 3X AAA batteries (not included)
1.Unscrew the tail cap and remove the 3X AAA battery holder.
2.Insert the 3XAAA batteries into the holder The cathode (-)of batteries must be touching the coils. you will notice an arrow on each wall of the battery case. When inserting loaded battery case , insert with the arrows facing down Then screw the tail cap back on.
II: 3.7V 18650 Rechargeable Battery (not included)
Remove protective plastic covering from the battery, Insert the clear plastic cylinder into the flashlight, then place the battery inside the cylinder with anode(+)side down. Screw the tail cap back on.
◆ On/Off Operation
Fully press the tail power switch to turn the light on, fully pressing again to turn the light off.
◆ 5 Mode Cycle
When the light is on, slightly press the tail mode switch to cycle through the five modes in the order of High, Middle, Low, Strobe, SOS, and back to High.
◆ Zoom
Push base of lens forward to zoom in, and pull back to zoo out.

If you have any problem or concern, please feel free to contact us. Thanks for your time.
Best Regards,
YIFENG

review_title: Very bright and good battery life.
reviews:
After a weeklong Scout camping trip I have nostalgia for our old flashlights that gave such little light that you would trip on your own feet. Most of the time I used these lights in the deep woods I was covering 3/4 of the light with my hand to keep from waking everyone up. These lights are fantastic, sturdy, very bright and had no problem with battery life.

Would be five stars but it needs a better switch for the various modes. Having to turn the light on and off multiple times to get to low power or strobe mode is inconvenient and often ends up making you cycle multiple times through the options to get what you want. When there was a deer digging into the trash at camp I cycled through three times to get on the strobe setting to drive it away.

These seem fairly well built and are surprisingly bright. The focus is adjusted by slide the larger, outer frame of the flashlight and while this works fine, I wonder how long the tension will hold up.

In any case, battery life seems good so far and having a couple of these on hand is great in case one needs a new set of batteries.

reviews:
The flashlight that works is amazing. However, one did not work and is being replaced at no charge to me.

The defect in the bad one is possibly dangereous. One of the metal conductors where battery is inserted is sticking out. When I inserted batteries flashlight did not work. Took battery cartridge out and it was extremely hot. Immediately removed all batteries which was tricky because it was so hot.

Advice....always check to see if working once batteries are inserted. If it works I doubt it will get this hot.

I expect this defect is rare, but because of this I can not give 5 stars. Based on the one that does work....it is a 5 star.

reviews: These are great little flashlights. I bought these instead of the ones they advertise on TV because you get two for the price of one, and they do the same thing. When you press harder, the light turns off completely.

review_title: All the amazing light and features of the TV clone, only cheaper!
reviews: Substantial value for the price. These flashlights surprised me by their size. At first sight I thought I was ripped off. They just fill your hand. But the light they produce is amazing. All functions were useful, the strobe function could actually disarm a would be attacker. Causing me to rethink their size. Could easily fit in ones pocket. They provide all the desirable qualities of the TV clone at a much smaller price. (If you have Prime for shipping) I bought some of these little gems for stocking stuffer gifts. The recipients were as pleased as I was. You won't be disappointed. *******It is approximately a year and 2 months since my Tac lights arrived. I keep them in our night stands for home defence.***** I grabbed one and tried to use it. It would not light! I opened it and tried to check the batteries. They were corroded. The battery holder was fused to the inside of flash light. Flash light sat for a year in the drawer, original batteries never used. I shook it off and grabbed the other one. ***** attempted to turn it on. NO LIGHT! I opened it up. Exactly the same, corroded and fused to the inside of the Flash Light! If you have recently purchased these. Remove the batteries immediately put in your own good ones. Or check to see if they have fixed this. I will add to this review when I find out how vendor responds.

reviews:
Put AAA batteries in the first one...worked great. Loaded up the second light and hit the power button multiple times...nothing. Took the cap off to look for something obvious and caught a hint of burning electrical smell. The batteries had gotten really hot, and two of the 3 springs for the negative posts have discolored and deformed.

After realizing that I can't send this back now, I compared the two lights and noticed that the faulty one has more metal sticking beyond the point where it is staked to the carriage. I guess that extra metal had bent and contacted/shorted out something. A small piece of tape over that metal seems to have resolved the issue..second .light works and no heat/burning. Still not completely confident in these, but time will tell

reviews: As a college student, this would be a great product for going to my car at night, camping, or backpacking. However, the lights are simply not durable enough. The electronics are very fragile, and one of the lights stopped working nearly as soon as I got it. I took it apart, and the only reason I can find for it being nonfunctional is due to the negative terminal on the LED being very poorly soldered, causing barely any connection. Sadly, the same thing has happened on my "good" flashlight, and it now sporadically flickers on and off. If the quality was higher, it would be perfect, but it simply is too poorly wired to sustain any heavy usage.

review_title: One flashlight defective-Hope to get it fixed
reviews:
Just received pack of two flashlights. They appear to be well made, however only one of the pair operate. One of the endcaps which contains the on/off switch and controls the mode is defective. When I switched the endcap to the other flashlight , it operated fine. I'm hoping I'll be able to get a replacement part so they both work. I'll keep you posted.
I have changed my rating to 5 stars!
Yifeng responded quickly and replaced the defective flashlight with a new one. It's a great product. I highly recommend it!

review_title: Went through others like that, and due to the reviews
reviews: I'd initially set out to buy the "as seen on tv" kind, but after looking at reviews, looked elsewhere. Went through others like that, and due to the reviews, went with this. Yes, it's as good as I was expecting! Living in Alaska, when it's dark, it is very, very dark. A good flashlight is a must, and this was exactly what we needed. Very bright when zoomed out, and when zoomed back in, covers a good, large area, although wish it was a little brighter. I do like the different modes, although, I'm not sure when we'd use the strobe. But, it's lightweight, compact, easy to carry. We bought enough for one in each vehicle, nightstands, and to place by the doors before we go out.

review_title: Love these YIFENF XML -T6 Portable 1600 lumen CREE LED ...
reviews:
Love these YIFENF XML -T6 Portable 1600 lumen CREE LED flashlights. I will be ordering more. I live in the mountains in a very rural area with homes miles apart. Flashlights are a staple for going outside at night. Thes XTAR 2 pk flahslight Battery Pouch Holster Holders work perfectly withe these flashlights. The light from the flashlight shines from my deck, over across a road and a large creek and up on the hill above in the aspens. I focus it in when my dog has treed some critter up the tree such as raccoons. Yet, when walking down to the barn I can expand the light and see the path ahead of me.
BTW- when I edited for a typo I left out part of the original post. I do not know how to measure Lumens so I have no way of knowing if this is or is not 1600 Lumens. I just know it works great for me when I do chores or check for the trees when my dog is barking up one at night.

review_title: and if you are like me, you will be left wondering what the ...
reviews:
What you see is what you ge i.e.TWO flashlights, nothing else. Don't expect any instructions on how to operate them. You have to go online to find that information. Actually, you will also get two plastic tubes, and if you are like me, you will be left wondering what the tubes are for. It turns out they are to slide in place of the AAA battery holder if you want the rechargeable battery type. I read here on reviews that some got a battery charger with their flashlights. Not me!

It's a bright flashlight but not as bright as I was expecting. The TV adverts make it out to be something really impressive. They are two small flashlights!

review_title: You'll love it if you don't mind waiting for the mode toggle switch that's integrated into the on/off switch.But I don't.
reviews:
They're sturdy and the function. Super bright with 3xAAA batteries but Imagine the drain within a short time. I've used it with the other batteries, not as bright but that may just be the make or the brand, not the battery type itself.

I give 2, because it's an excellent craft, bulb as well as output and shouldn't break, but I didn't pay close attention to the specs before buying, it's another one of those modes built into the on off switch rather than a separate switch. Y'know a lot of effort and quality but an asinine design because that ONE feature. If it wasn't for this it would 5 out of 5. All I want is max torch with one quick push of a button. ONE time and no waiting for it to cycle. My fault for not paying closer attention, but I do not like it because of this. How difficult could it be to put a separate mode switch on the thing? It's asinine. All of the effort to fabricate these yet they couldn't engineer a second switch. It's so stupid, It's no wonder they're so cheap, THAT feature SUCKS. That one feature demotes it from excellent to mediocre junk.

Don't misunderstand, I'm not angry, just dramatic because it's silly.
product_name: Tactical Flashlight, YIFENG XML T6 Ultra Bright LED Flashlight with Adjustable Focus and 5 Light Modes for Camping Hiking (2 Pack)
rank:

reviews:
I use flashlights often. I own many types of flashlights. I recently wanted to buy some small flashlights for our camping gear. looking online at the reviews i was bewildered at the varying reviews for many of the same flashliights. We decided on this one and the J5 hyper-v and the J5 V1 pro. This two flashlight package cost less than the J5 Hyper V. Just a little more than the J5 V1 Pro. This flashlight is hands down with the exact same batteries 3 to 4 times brighter than both of the J5 Tactical Flashlights. In fact as soon as I tested them with many batteries, I quickly bought 2 more of these flashlights. They have a larger light area on full. Putting the zoom 100 percent on top of the J5 zoomed 100 percent the J5 is not there!. It completely obliterates the J5. I actually think we will return the J5 and buy even more of these to have around the house.
Wow the best flashlight I have ever owned!
Only downside is it is a little heavier, and it does not have a pocket clip. Buy this flashlight you will not regret it.

review_title: 5 out of 5 stars, get several at this incredibly low price!
reviews:
These flashlights are absolutely great. 5 out of 5 stars. I bought one of these at the fair for $45, used it all the time, and was very happy with it until it got lost during hunting season last fall. I went searching for another and then saw the price on Amazon was $17 for 2, so I bought 4 more. One for each car, one for my hunting backpack, and one for the house. Now that I think about it, I should get a few more while the price is low. The light is VERY bright( 1000 Lumens ). When zoomed all the way out, it has a square beam of light. I recommend getting some rechargeable batteries for it as you'll want to use it all the time.
5 out of 5 stars, absolutely love it!!

reviews: These flashlights are BRIGHT. Can't believe the value on these things. Gave one to my neighbor all the way down the block and he practically blinded me from that far away. This caused another neighbor to come outside to find out "what the hell the light was all about". They can be adjusted to create a huge spotlight, or shrink down to a small beam to work on something right in front of you. You can dim them by pressing the button at the end gently. Also can blink like a strobe. Read the instructions, it takes a minute to figure it out without them. These will be my Christmas presents for everyone this year, hope the price is still the same!.

The issue with the YI-FENG is that the user should be able to set a primary position and turn it on to that, not scroll through the settings to get to strobe in particular. reviews:
Lights worked as advertised at first, but after a just a few uses on one light the contact spring inside detached with broken solder connection and I see no way to reattach it so the light is ruined! Both lights put a out a bright light and the focus and other options work great.

UPDATE: YIFENG read my review and sent me a new flashlight replacement very courteous and promptly. So far so good on the replacement light. Good customer service.
